1.text: Jesus told his disciples, “It is impossible that no occasions of stumbling should come, but woe to the one through whom they come!

2.text: It would be better for such a person to have a millstone hung around the neck and be thrown into the sea, rather than to cause any of these little ones to stumble.

3.text: Be careful! If your brother sins against you, rebuke him. If he repents, forgive him.

4.text: If he sins against you seven times in the day, and comes back seven times, saying: ‘I repent!’ you must forgive him.”

5.text: The apostles also said to the Lord, “Increase our faith!”

6.text: The Lord said, “If you have faith like a grain of mustard seed, you would tell this sycamore tree, ‘Be uprooted and transplanted into the sea,’ and it would obey you!

7.text: Now who is there among you, having a slave plowing or sheepherding, that will say when that slave returns from the field, ‘Come at once and sit down at the table.’

8.text: Instead, will you not tell him, ‘Prepare my supper, clothe yourself properly, and serve me while I eat and drink. Afterwards, you may eat and drink’?

9.text: Does the master thank that slave because he did the things that were commanded? I think not!

10.text: So you also, when you have done all those things which you are commanded [to do], say, ‘We are unworthy slaves; we have [only] done our duty!’”

11.text: As Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem, it happened that he was passing between [the borders of] Samaria and Galilee.

12.text: As he entered into a certain village, ten men who were lepers met him, and they stood at a distance.

13.text: They lifted up their voices, saying, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”

14.text: When Jesus saw them, he told them, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” And it happened that as they went, they were cleansed.

15.text: One of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, glorifying God with a loud voice.

16.text: He fell on his face at Jesus’ feet, giving him thanks; and this man was a Samaritan.

17.text: Jesus said, “Were not ten cleansed? But where are the nine [others]?

18.text: Was no one found who came back to glorify God, except for this foreigner?”

19.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Get up and go your way. Your faith has healed you!”

20.text: Being asked by the Pharisees when the Kingdom of God would come, Jesus answered them, “The Kingdom of God does not come with observation.

21.text: Neither will people say, ‘Look, here!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ for behold, the Kingdom of God is within you.”

22.text: Jesus told the disciples, “The days will come when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.

23.text: And people will tell you, ‘Look there, look here!’ Do not go away or follow [them],

24.text: for as the lightning that flashes and lights up the sky from one side to the other, so also will the Son of Man be in his day.

25.text: But first, he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.

26.text: As it happened in the days of Noah, so will it be in the days of the Son of Man.

27.text: People ate, drank, got married and were given in marriage, until the day when Noah entered into the ark; and the flood came, destroying them all.

28.text: Likewise, as it also happened in the days of Lot: people ate, drank, bought, sold, planted and built.

29.text: But in the day that Lot went out from Sodom, it rained fire and sulfur from the sky which destroyed them all.

30.text: It will be the same in the day that the Son of Man is revealed.

31.text: In that day, whoever is on the housetop, [having] his goods in the house, should not go down to take them away! Likewise, whoever is in the field should not return.

33.text: Whoever seeks to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life will preserve it.

34.text: I tell you that in that night, there will be two people in one bed! One will be taken, and the other will be left.

35.text: There will be two grinding grain together. One will be taken, and the other will be left.”

36.text: Two will be in the field: one will be taken, and the other left.

37.text: In reply, the disciples asked him, “Where, Lord?” He said to them, “Where the body is, there the eagles will also be assembled.”
